title: RRB Clerk Prelims: Quant (7th Dec Shift 2) #QA017

questions.text: The number of pens is three times the number of pencils, and the number of erasers is 12 less than the number of pens. If the average number of pens, pencils, and erasers is 10, find the number of pens.
questions.solution: Let Pencils = x. Pens = 3x. Erasers = 3x - 12. Average = 10 -> Sum = 30. x + 3x + (3x - 12) = 30 -> 7x = 42 -> x = 6. Pens = 3 * 6 = 18.

questions.text: The quantities of milk in three jars A, B, and C are in the ratio 4:1:2 respectively. The total amount of milk in all three jars together is 28 liters. If 4 liters of milk are added to jar B, find the new ratio of milk in jars A, B, and C respectively.
questions.solution: Total parts = 4+1+2=7. 1 part = 28/7 = 4L. A=16L, B=4L, C=8L. Add 4L to B -> B becomes 8L. New Ratio A:B:C = 16:8:8 = 2:1:1.

questions.text: A man invested equal amounts in two schemes, Scheme A and Scheme B. Scheme A offers simple interest at 8% per annum for 2 years, while Scheme B offers simple interest at 14% per annum for 2 years. The total simple interest earned from both schemes together is Rs 4,400. Find the amount invested in Scheme A (in Rs).

Tanisha and Juli started a business together with a total investment of Rs 5,000. After 8 months, Juli left the business. At the end of the year, the profit-sharing ratio of Tanisha to Juli was equal. Find the initial investment of Tanisha (in Rs).
A train crosses a platform in 21 seconds while running at a speed of 72 km/h. The length of the platform is 60 meters more than the length of the train. Find the length of the train (in meters).
questions.solution: Speed = 72 * 5/18 = 20 m/s. Distance = 20 * 21 = 420m. Let Train = L, Platform = L+60. 2L + 60 = 420 -> 2L = 360 -> L = 180.

questions.text: The monthly incomes of Mahesh and Hari are in the ratio of 5: 6 respectively. Mahesh spends 20% of his income on rent, 25% of the remaining amount on EMI, and 10% of the remaining amount on food. He saves the rest of his income. If Mahesh's savings amount to Rs 13,500, find the monthly income (in Rs) of Hari.
questions.solution: Mahesh Income = 5x. Rem after Rent = 0.8 * 5x = 4x. Rem after EMI = 0.75 * 4x = 3x. Rem after Food (Savings) = 0.9 * 3x = 2.7x. 2.7x = 13500 -> x = 5000. Hari Income = 6x = 30000.

questions.text: The present ages of two sons together are equal to the present age of their father. Three years ago, the age of the elder son was half of his father's age at that time. If the present age of the younger son is 23 years, then find the age (in years) of the father after 1 year from now.
questions.solution: Let Elder = E, Father = F. E + 23 = F. 3 years ago: (E-3) = 1/2 * (F-3). 2E - 6 = F - 3 -> F = 2E - 3. Equate F: E + 23 = 2E - 3 -> E = 26. F = 26 + 23 = 49. Age after 1 year = 50.

questions.text: The area of a rectangle is 98 cmÂ², and the breadth of the rectangle is half of its length. Find the sum of the length and breadth of the rectangle (in cm).

A can complete a piece of work in 20 days, and B can complete the same work in 30 days. Working together, A, B, and C can finish the work in 10 days. Find the number of days C alone would take to complete the work.
A shopkeeper marks the price of an article 50% above its cost price and allows a 20% discount on the marked price. If the profit earned is Rs 40, find the discount allowed (in Rs).
Find the wrong number in the series: 12000, 6000, 3000, 1500, 750, 325
questions.solution: Pattern is divide by 2. 750 / 2 = 375. 325 is wrong.

questions.text: Find the wrong number in the series: 1.5, 3, 29, 117, 469, 1877, 7509
questions.solution: Pattern: x4 + 1. 1.5 * 4 + 1 = 7. 7 * 4 + 1 = 29. The term 3 is wrong.

questions.text: Find the wrong number in the series: 160, 173, 190, 209, 232, 260, 292
questions.solution: Diffs: 13, 17, 19, 23 (Prime numbers). Next diff should be 29. 232 + 29 = 261. 260 is wrong.

questions.text: Find the wrong number in the series: 285, 281, 265, 229, 160, 65
Find the wrong number in the series: 10, 1343, 2343, 3072, 3584, 3927, 4143

questions.solution: Correction from PDF solution: Answer key says 1. Logic: (25/69)*(23/5)*(1/25) = (1/3)*(1/5) = 1/15. Wait, PDF says result is 7/15? No, Q80 says "= 7/15"? No, it says "... = ?". Solution says "= 2/15 -> ?=1". This might be a variable equation. Let's assume standard simplification: (25/69)*(23/5)*(1/25) = 1/15. If options are integers (5, 3, 8, 1, 4), maybe the question is different. PDF Source 1281 says "(25/69 * 23/5 * 1/25) = 2/15? No, solution says ?=1". Let's trust the answer key (d) which is 1.
